Interface ICharManager

public interface ICharManager
Manager for the server's custom Unicode character registry.

ICharManager maintains a named catalogue of special Unicode characters — symbols, decorative glyphs, custom texture-pack icons — that plugins and players can reference by a human-readable name rather than a raw Unicode code point. This decouples code and configuration from fragile character literals and makes it easy to add, remove, or remap characters without touching call sites.

How it works

Each entry in the registry consists of:

  • A name — a stable, lowercase string identifier (e.g. "heart", "star", "coin").
  • A character — the actual Unicode string (often a single code point or a short sequence) assigned to that name.

Typical usage

ICharManager chars = ProudCoreAPI.get().getCharManager();

// Safe lookup with existence check
if (chars.exists("coin")) {
    player.sendMessage("Balance: 500 " + chars.getChar("coin"));
}

// Register a new icon for a custom texture pack
String icon = chars.addChar("clan_shield");
if (icon != null) {
    System.out.println("Registered clan_shield as: " + icon);
}

// Remove a deprecated character
chars.removeChar("old_icon");
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • getChar

      String getChar(String name)
      Returns the Unicode string mapped to the given name, or null if no such character is registered.

      The returned string is the raw Unicode representation of the character (e.g. ""). It can be embedded directly in any text context that supports Unicode, such as chat messages, item display names, or book contents.

      Parameters:
      name - the registry identifier to look up; must not be null
      Returns:
      the Unicode character string, or null if the name is unknown
      See Also:
      • exists(String)

    • exists

      boolean exists(String name)
      Returns true if a character is registered under the given name.

      Use this method as a guard before calling getChar(String) when the existence of the character cannot be guaranteed, such as when the name originates from player input or external configuration.

      Parameters:
      name - the registry identifier to test; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if a character with that name exists, false otherwise

    • getAllNames

      Set<String> getAllNames()
      Returns an unmodifiable view of all registered character names.

      The returned Set reflects the current state of the registry. Attempting to modify it will throw UnsupportedOperationException. The set may be empty but is never null.

      Returns:
      a non-null, unmodifiable set of all registered names

    • getCharInfo

      Map<String,String> getCharInfo(String name)
      Returns a map of metadata about the specified character, or null if the name is not registered.

      The map may include entries such as:

      • "unicode" — the raw Unicode code point(s)
      • "category" — a grouping label (e.g. "ui", "emoji")
      • "createdAt" — ISO-8601 timestamp of when the entry was added

      The exact set of keys is implementation-defined. Callers should treat any key as optional and handle its absence gracefully.

      Parameters:
      name - the registry identifier of the character; must not be null
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable map of metadata key-value pairs, or null if the character does not exist

    • getCharsCount

      int getCharsCount()
      Returns the total number of characters currently registered.

      This count includes every entry in the registry, regardless of whether the associated Unicode slot is actively used or reserved for future use.

      Returns:
      the total registered character count; always >= 0

    • getAvailableCharsCount

      int getAvailableCharsCount()
      Returns the number of character slots still available for new registrations.

      The registry may have a hard upper bound (e.g. a fixed block of private-use Unicode code points). This method exposes the remaining capacity. A return value of 0 means addChar(String) will fail until existing characters are removed.

      Returns:
      the number of slots available for new characters; always >= 0

    • addChar

      String addChar(String name)
      Registers a new character under the given name and returns its assigned Unicode string.

      The implementation automatically selects the next available Unicode code point (typically from a private-use area) and maps it to the provided name. The operation fails — returning null — if:

      • A character with the same name is already registered.
      • The registry has reached its maximum capacity (getAvailableCharsCount() returns 0).
      • An internal storage error occurs.
      Parameters:
      name - the unique identifier for the new character; must not be null or blank
      Returns:
      the Unicode string assigned to the new character, or null if the operation failed
      See Also:
      • removeChar(String)

    • removeChar

      boolean removeChar(String name)
      Removes the character registered under the given name from the registry.

      After removal, the name is no longer resolvable via getChar(String) and the freed slot becomes available for a future addChar(String) call. Any code that cached the Unicode character string of the removed entry will continue to render it visually (the font/texture does not change), but future lookups by name will return null.

      Parameters:
      name - the registry identifier of the character to remove; must not be null
      Returns:
      true if the character existed and was removed, false if no character with that name was found
      See Also:
      • addChar(String)
